page.title: 17Sythwood's Nature Area
page.content: Our school is built right in the centre of a densely populated housing estate. It was much appreciated then, by local residents, when last year every class in the school participated in a planting exercise to create a long herbaceous border around two sides of the playground. At the same time we began turning a wild area of a couple of acres within our grounds into a nature area, complete with a pond. This is the only area of its kind in the entire estate, Goldsworth Park (Europe's largest). Some children have cleared much of the ground beneath the trees, creating a network of paths for the rest of the pupils. Frogs and many insects have come to live in our pond, while a vast variety of flowers has been discovered including, for the first time in this area, orchids.
